svg.title: Energy to ionize the first electron
svg.desc:
Energy required to ionize the first electron from an atom.
The ionization energy data is from http://www.science.co.il/PTelements.asp?s=ionization
Languages: en, de
The graph is derived from
Wikpedia Commons, User:Sponk, http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Erste_Ionisierungsenergie_PSE_color_coded.png
German Wikipedia, User:JJnoDog, http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Datei:IonizationEnergyAtomicWeight.PNG http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:IonizationEnergyAtomicWeight.PNG
See also Raymond Chang, Chemistry, 2nd edition, Random House, 1984, page 166
Unlike above figures, the elements are not joined with line segments because the data is discrete. Lines are drawn from the abscissa to the noble gases to signal the end of a periodic table row.

switch.text: Năng lượng ion hóa thứ nhất
ก๊าซมีตระกูล
